sect1.title: Installation as Add-on
sect1.para: For using the &hasi; and &hageo;, you need the packages included in the following installation patterns:

note.title: Package Requirements for Arbitrators
note.para: If your &geo; cluster setup includes one or more arbitrators (see ), those only need the pattern Geographical Clustering. For instructions on how to install this pattern, see .

sect1.para: Both patterns are only available if you have registered your system at &ncc; (or a local registration server) and have added the respective product channels or installation media as add-ons. For information on how to install add-on products, see the &sle; &productnumber; &deploy;, available at &suse-onlinedoc;. Refer to chapter Installing Add-On Products.

sect2.title: Installing the Packages on Cluster Nodes
sect2.para: In case both &hasi; and &hageo; have been added as add-on products, but the packages are not installed yet, proceed as follows:

step.para: To install the packages from both patterns via command line, use Zypper:
step.screen: sudo zypper in -t pattern ha_sles ha_geo

step.para: Alternatively, use &yast; for a graphical installation:
Start &yast; as &rootuser; user and select Software Software Management .
Click View Patterns and activate the following patterns:
Click Accept to start installing the packages.

important.title: Installing Software Packages on all Parties
important.para: The software packages needed for &ha; and &geo; clusters are not automatically copied to the cluster nodes.

listitem.para: Install &sls; &productnumber; and the &ha; and Geographical Clustering patterns on all machines that will be part of your &geo; cluster.

If you do not want to install the packages manually on all nodes that will be part of your cluster, use &ay; to clone existing nodes. Find more information in the &haguide; for &productname; &productnumber;, available from &suse-onlinedoc;. Refer to chapter Installation and Basic Setup, section Mass Deployment with &ay;.
For all machines that need the &hageo; add-on, you currently need to install the packages for &geo; clusters manually. &ay; support for &hageo; is not yet available.
